publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4851.1♦ Maureen Watt: Kintore Station and Aberdeen Crossrail—As an amendment to motion (S3M-4851) in the name of Mike Rumbles, leave out from "the decision" to end and insert "it was the current Scottish Government that delivered the long awaited station reopening, and believes that such projects are testament to the Scottish Government’s commitment to improving transport links in the north east."
S3M-4851.1 Kintore Station and Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 16 September 2009) Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Brian Adam*, Stuart McMillan*, Rob Gibson*

S3M-4851.1 Maureen Watt: Kintore Station and Aberdeen Crossrail—As an amendment to motion (S3M-4851) in the name of Mike Rumbles, leave out from "the decision" to end and insert "it was the current Scottish Government that delivered the long awaited station reopening, and believes that such projects are testament to the Scottish Government’s commitment to improving transport links in the north east." Supported by: Shirley-Anne Somerville, Brian Adam, Stuart McMillan, Rob Gibson, Dave Thompson*, Aileen Campbell*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-4851.1 Kintore Station and Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 16 September 2009) Ian McKee*
S3M-4851.1 Kintore Station and Aberdeen Crossrail (lodged on 16 September 2009) Nigel Don*
